translated: For example, the wind in the sky is not fatigued.

original: de bzhin du lha rnams la'ang ngal ba'i skyon med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du lha rnams la'ang ngal ba'i skyon med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the gods are not harmed by fatigue.

original: yid gsal ba'i lha rnams kyi lus ni yang la dri ma dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: yid gsal ba'i lha rnams kyi lus ni yang la dri ma dang bral ba yin no //
translated: The bodies of the gods with clear minds are light and free from impurities.

original: thams cad du 'gro bar nus pa dag ni gzugs ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gyur la /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro bar nus pa dag ni gzugs ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gyur la /
translated: They are able to go everywhere and their bodies become whatever they wish.

original: lha dang / lha mo rab tu dga' bas kun tu gang ba /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo rab tu dga' bas kun tu gang ba /
translated: The gods and goddesses are filled with intense joy.

original: lha'i na chung thams cad tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dag na 'khod pa /
analyzed: lha'i na chung thams cad tshal dang / nye ba'i tshal dag na 'khod pa /
translated: All the young gods are in the forests and parks.

original: lha dang / lha mo rnams lhan cig 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'dod pa myong bar bya ba /
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo rnams lhan cig 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga 'dod pa myong bar bya ba /

original: sdug pa myong bar bya ba /
analyzed: sdug pa myong bar bya ba /
translated: They experience what is beautiful.üîΩThey experience what is delightful.

original: yid du 'ong ba myong bar bya ba dang / bde bar gnas pa myong bar bya ba rnams kyis dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba myong bar bya ba dang / bde bar gnas pa myong bar bya ba rnams kyis dga' bar byed do //
translated: They experience the happiness of abiding.

original: de ltar phan tshun gnas pa mtho ris kyi gnas ri brags dang; tshal dang nye ba'i tshal gyi bar sna tshogs dag na 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal rtsis la ma chags par yul mi brtan pa rnams kyis nyin gcig bzhin myos pa bag med par gnas pa dga' ba'i
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun gnas pa mtho ris kyi gnas ri brags dang; tshal dang nye ba'i tshal gyi bar sna tshogs dag na 'bral ba'i sdug bsngal rtsis la ma chags par yul mi brtan pa rnams kyis nyin gcig bzhin myos pa bag med par gnas pa dga' ba'i
translated: In this way, they live together in the various realms of the higher realms, in the mountains, forests, and parks, without any concern for the suffering of separation. They live in a state of intoxication and carelessness, experiencing unstable objects.

original: 'dod chags kyi mod las byung ba'i sred pas bslus pa rnams /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi mod las byung ba'i sred pas bslus pa rnams /
translated: They are deceived by the craving that arises from desire.

original: ji srid du de'i 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba'i las mtho ris su skye bar rgyu las byung ba /
analyzed: ji srid du de'i 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba'i las mtho ris su skye bar rgyu las byung ba /
translated: As long as the causes for the arising of the higher realms, which are the actions of desire, beauty, and pleasure, have not been exhausted,

original: byas shing @90b  bsags pa zad par ma gyur pa de srid du dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: byas shing @90b  bsags pa zad par ma gyur pa de srid du dga' bar byed do //

original: de phyis de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de phyis de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /

original: shi nas kyang rang gi las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang rang gi las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro'i nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In accordance with their karmic actions, they will be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals.

original: gal te yang legs par byas pa'i las kyis mi dang / so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /üîΩlas de dang / rgyu mthun par de grong khyer gyi dpon po'am /
analyzed: gal te yang legs par byas pa'i las kyis mi dang / so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na / las de dang / rgyu mthun par de grong khyer gyi dpon po'am /
translated: If, due to their previous positive actions, they are born among humans who experience the effects of their actions,

original: yul gyi dpon por 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gyi dpon por 'gyur te /
translated: they will, in accordance with their causal actions, become the head of a city or the head of a region.

original: skye bo rtag tu dga' ba rnams kyis gang ba'i yul du skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: skye bo rtag tu dga' ba rnams kyis gang ba'i yul du skye bar 'gyur la /

original: nad med pa dang / gzugs bzang po dang ldan par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: nad med pa dang / gzugs bzang po dang ldan par 'gyur ba mthong ngo //
translated: They will be healthy and have a beautiful body.

original: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: Again, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmaüîΩ

original: lha phreng thogs kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: lha phreng thogs kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúNext, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will consider the realm of the garland-bearer gods.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha phreng thogs rnams kyi gnas thams cad dga' bar gnas zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //üîΩder sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas lha phreng thogs rnams kyi gnas thams cad dga' bar gnas zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo // der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the realm of the garland-bearer gods is known as Abiding in Delight.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to take birth there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems pa gang gis gzhan la mi gnod par me tog bskyed nas sam /üîΩtshong zong gis nyos nas btogs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems pa gang gis gzhan la mi gnod par me tog bskyed nas sam / tshong zong gis nyos nas btogs te /
translated: He will then notice how some people who are endowed with discipline may grow flowers without harming others,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phul na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la phul na /
translated: or purchase them and then offer them to the blessed buddhas.

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten thams cad dga' bar gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar @91a *//
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten thams cad dga' bar gnas pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skye bar @91a *//
translated: When they later separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the gods in Abiding in Delight.

original: 'gyur ro // der skyes nas kyang de bde ba rnam pa bzhi myong bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // der skyes nas kyang de bde ba rnam pa bzhi myong bar 'gyur te / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are those four?

original: 'gran zla med pa dang / gar dga' mgur 'gro ba dang / lha gzhan gyis zil gyis mi non pa dang / lha mo'ang lha gzhan la mi rten pa dang / sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pas skyed par byed /

original: yongs su spyod par byed /
analyzed: yongs su spyod par byed /
translated: They will enjoy themselves,

original: rtse bar byed /üîΩdga' bar byed; yang dag par dga' bar byed cing gnas so //
analyzed: rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed; yang dag par dga' bar byed cing gnas so //
translated: play,üîΩand delight in the five types of musical instruments.

original: rtse ba dam pa sna tshogs kyis rtse bar byed de /
analyzed: rtse ba dam pa sna tshogs kyis rtse bar byed de /
translated: They will play with various kinds of excellent games,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: chu na rtse ba dang / padma'i rdzing la rtse ba dang / me tog la rtse ba dang / 'bras bu la rtse ba dang / spos la rtse ba dang / bya la rtse ba dang / tshal gyi nang na rgyu zhing rtse ba dang /
analyzed: chu na rtse ba dang / padma'i rdzing la rtse ba dang / me tog la rtse ba dang / 'bras bu la rtse ba dang / spos la rtse ba dang / bya la rtse ba dang / tshal gyi nang na rgyu zhing rtse ba dang /
translated: playing in the water, playing in lotus ponds, playing with flowers, playing with fruits, playing with perfumes, playing with birds, and playing while strolling through the forests.

original: bung ba sgra 'byin pas rtse la phan tshun lta bas mi ngoms pa'i lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba dag dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: bung ba sgra 'byin pas rtse la phan tshun lta bas mi ngoms pa'i lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba dag dga' bar byed do //
translated: The gods and goddesses there are surrounded by flocks of goddesses who are never satisfied with looking at each other, and they enjoy themselves.

original: lha dang / lha mo phan tshun du phrag dog byed pa'i sdug bsngal spangs pa dag dri shin tu zhim pos legs par bde ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: lha dang / lha mo phan tshun du phrag dog byed pa'i sdug bsngal spangs pa dag dri shin tu zhim pos legs par bde ba dang ldan no //
translated: The gods and goddesses, free from the suffering of jealousy, are well-endowed with the most delightful fragrances.

original: gnas de na padma'i rdzing rnams kyis kyang yongs su bskor ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas de na padma'i rdzing rnams kyis kyang yongs su bskor ba yin te /
translated: That place is also surrounded by lotus ponds.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely:

original: padma'i rdzing shin tu dri zhim pa dang / padma ma rnyis pa'i padma'i rdzing dang / padma dang / autpa lar 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i padma'i rdzing dang / de dang / gzhan dag gis kyang rtag tu gang ba'i rdzing dag yod de /
analyzed: padma'i rdzing shin tu dri zhim pa dang / padma ma rnyis pa'i padma'i rdzing dang / padma dang / autpa lar 'dres pa dang ldan pa'i padma'i rdzing dang / de dang / gzhan dag gis kyang rtag tu gang ba'i rdzing dag yod de /
translated: the lotus pond of extremely fragrant lotuses, the lotus pond of unfaded lotuses, the lotus pond of mixed lotuses and utpalas, and the lotus pond of always full water.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i padma rnam pa du ma dag gis padma'i rdzing de kun nas khebs @91b pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i padma rnam pa du ma dag gis padma'i rdzing de kun nas khebs @91b pa yin no //
translated: Those lotus ponds are completely covered with many such kinds of lotuses.

original: de rnams su lha dga' ba la gnas pa dag shin tu nyams dga' ba dang / mchog tu bde bar byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bde ba myang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams su lha dga' ba la gnas pa dag shin tu nyams dga' ba dang / mchog tu bde bar byed pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi bde ba myang ngo //
translated: In these places, the gods who delight in pleasure experience various kinds of happiness that are extremely delightful and supremely blissful.

original: tshal gser gyi lo ma can bung bas 'khrigs pa'i tshal gyi bar bar dag na'ang dga' bar byed do //
analyzed: tshal gser gyi lo ma can bung bas 'khrigs pa'i tshal gyi bar bar dag na'ang dga' bar byed do //
translated: They enjoy themselves in the forest of Golden Leaves and in the forest filled with bees.

original: spos sna tshogs dang ldan pa dag na bya sgra snyan pa 'byin pa dag kyang thos te /
analyzed: spos sna tshogs dang ldan pa dag na bya sgra snyan pa 'byin pa dag kyang thos te /
translated: They hear the sweet songs of birds in the forests filled with various fragrances.

original: de'i khyad par ni mi'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa dag gis bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
analyzed: de'i khyad par ni mi'i sil snyan yan lag lnga dang ldan pa dag gis bcu drug gi char yang mi phod do //
translated: The difference is that the music of the five types of instruments of humans cannot match even a sixteenth of the divine music.

original: de ltar de dag gi mig kyang gzugs rnams kyis yang dag par tshim par byed /
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi mig kyang gzugs rnams kyis yang dag par tshim par byed /
translated: In this way, the eyes of the gods are satisfied by forms.

original: rna ba'ang rol mo sna tshogs dang / glu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis snyan par byed /
analyzed: rna ba'ang rol mo sna tshogs dang / glu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis snyan par byed /
translated: The ears are delighted by various kinds of music and songs.

original: pags pa'ang gos thags su ma btags pa rnams kyis 'jam par byed /
analyzed: pags pa'ang gos thags su ma btags pa rnams kyis 'jam par byed /
translated: The skin is soothed by the soft fabrics of their clothes.

original: sna'ang lha'i dri rnam pa du mas zhim par byed de /
analyzed: sna'ang lha'i dri rnam pa du mas zhim par byed de /
translated: The nose is delighted by the many divine fragrances.

original: de ltar yul lnga la chags pa de dga' ba rnam pa du ma dang / gzugs rgyun mi 'chad pa gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa gzhan gyis bskrun du med pa'i bde ba du ma dang / lha'i bza' ba dang / btung ba mdog bzang ba dri dang /
analyzed: de ltar yul lnga la chags pa de dga' ba rnam pa du ma dang / gzugs rgyun mi 'chad pa gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa gzhan gyis bskrun du med pa'i bde ba du ma dang / lha'i bza' ba dang / btung ba mdog bzang ba dri dang /
translated: In this way, they are attached to the five objects and experience many kinds of pleasures, such as uninterrupted and unadulterated forms that are not created by others and that bring about many kinds of bliss.

original: ro zhim pa du ma dag kyang myong ngo //
analyzed: ro zhim pa du ma dag kyang myong ngo //
translated: They also experience divine food and drink that are of excellent color, smell, and taste.

original: de gar dga' bar yang 'gro ste /
analyzed: de gar dga' bar yang 'gro ste /
translated: They can go wherever they wish.

original: rang gi las dang mthun par gar dga' bar 'gro'o //
analyzed: rang gi las dang mthun par gar dga' bar 'gro'o //
translated: In accordance with their own karmic actions, they can go wherever they wish.

original: de ltar de tshal nas tshal dang / padma'i rdzing nas padma'i rdzing dang; nye ba'i tshal nas nye ba'i tshal dag tu lha mo'i tshogs du mas yongs su bskor te yongs su rgyu bar byed cing bde ba sna tshogs dag la gnas so //üîΩde 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba'i @92a *//
analyzed: de ltar de tshal nas tshal dang / padma'i rdzing nas padma'i rdzing dang; nye ba'i tshal nas nye ba'i tshal dag tu lha mo'i tshogs du mas yongs su bskor te yongs su rgyu bar byed cing bde ba sna tshogs dag la gnas so // de 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba'i @92a *//
translated: In this way, they will travel from forest to forest, from lotus pond to lotus pond, and from park to park, surrounded by many groups of goddesses. They will experience various kinds of pleasures.

original: las kyis 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa na /
analyzed: las kyis 'bras bu la nye bar spyod pa na /
translated: As they experience the effects of their own desirable, attractive, and delightful actions,

original: shing ljon pa rang gi 'od dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba /
analyzed: shing ljon pa rang gi 'od dang ldan pa rnams kyis yongs su bskor ba /
translated: The trees are radiant and the birds are golden.

original: gser gyi bya'i tshogs kyi sgra thos na yid 'phrog par byed pa rnams kyis rna bar snyan par byed de /üîΩde ltar de lha'i gzugs kyi bde ba dpe med pa du mas gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa de ji srid du de'i 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba /üîΩzhing dam pas bskyed pa /
analyzed: gser gyi bya'i tshogs kyi sgra thos na yid 'phrog par byed pa rnams kyis rna bar snyan par byed de / de ltar de lha'i gzugs kyi bde ba dpe med pa du mas gzhan gyis mi 'phrogs pa de ji srid du de'i 'dod pa sdug pa yid du 'ong ba / zhing dam pas bskyed pa /
translated: The sounds of the birds are delightful to hear.

original: mthar mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i las zad par ma gyur pa de srid du myong bar byed do //
analyzed: mthar mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i las zad par ma gyur pa de srid du myong bar byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, the gods experience the most exquisite and incomparable divine forms, and they are not deprived of these pleasures until finally their positive acts with desirable, attractive, and delightful effects that were initiated in pure ways and that are to be exhausted have been consumed.

original: gang gi tshe zad par gyur te phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zad par gyur te phyis lha'i 'jig rten de nas 'chi bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen that happens, they will die and leave their divine world.

original: shi nas kyang rang gi las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi nas kyang rang gi las nye bar 'gro ba ji lta ba bzhin sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death they will be born among hell beings, starving spirits, or animals, in accordance with their karmic actions.

original: gal te mi dang so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
analyzed: gal te mi dang so so yang dag par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyis mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na /
translated: If they are born among humans due to karmic actions to be experienced as a human,

original: de grong khyer ram grong khyer chung ngur dbang byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de grong khyer ram grong khyer chung ngur dbang byed par 'gyur /
translated: they will become rulers of a city or a small town.

original: 'byor pa mang ba dang / blo rgya che ba dang / bran khol du ma dang ldan pa dang / shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa dang / zhing bzang po la legs par byas pa'i las des mthar mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo //üîΩde nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
analyzed: 'byor pa mang ba dang / blo rgya che ba dang / bran khol du ma dang ldan pa dang / shin tu bde ba dang ldan pa dang / zhing bzang po la legs par byas pa'i las des mthar mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba mthong ngo // de nas yang dge slong las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa shes pa de /
translated: They will have many resources, be very intelligent, have many servants, be very happy, and through their wholesome and virtuous actions, they will eventually attain the transcendence of suffering.

original: lha phreng thogs kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
analyzed: lha phreng thogs kyi gnas la rtog par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúNext, the monk who has knowledge of the ripening of karmic effects will examine the realm of the garland-bearer gods.

original: des thos pa las byung @92b ba'i shes pas lha'i 'jig rten gyi gnas dag na lha'i gnas 'gro ma gyogs zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: des thos pa las byung @92b ba'i shes pas lha'i 'jig rten gyi gnas dag na lha'i gnas 'gro ma gyogs zhes bya ba ji ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo //
translated: With knowledge derived from hearing he will then see that the realm of the gods in the world of the gods is called Swift Movement.

original: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: der sems can dag las gang gis skye bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: Wondering what karmic actions may cause beings to be born there, he will apply knowledge derived from hearing.

original: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
analyzed: des thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas brtags na /
translated: Investigating with knowledge derived from hearing, he will see that

original: tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pa gang gis tshal mes bsregs pa'i gsab gseb tu srog chags dag sreg pa na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan par gyur pa gang gis tshal mes bsregs pa'i gsab gseb tu srog chags dag sreg pa na /
translated: those who are endowed with discipline will, when insects are being burned in a forest fire,

original: chus gtor te thar par byas pa dang / skad cig de la shi ba la thug pa rnams kyi 'jigs pa bskyabs na /
analyzed: chus gtor te thar par byas pa dang / skad cig de la shi ba la thug pa rnams kyi 'jigs pa bskyabs na /
translated: rescue them by sprinkling them with water and protecting them from the danger of death.

original: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha phreng thogs rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lus dang bral nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha phreng thogs rnams kyi nang du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When they later separate from their bodies, they will go to the joyful higher realms and be born among the garland-bearer gods.

original: der skyes nas kyang mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pa /
analyzed: der skyes nas kyang mi 'jigs pa sbyin par byed pa /
translated: ‚ÄúOnce born there, they will be able to grant fearlessness.

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i tshul khrims kyi rgyu las byung ba de lha'i bde ba dpe med pa de myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, they will experience the incomparable pleasures of the gods, which are the effects of the discipline of granting fearlessness.

original: de'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ba de ba dag 'thob la /
analyzed: de'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya ba de ba dag 'thob la /
translated: They will obtain divine forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures.

original: lha mo'i tshogs brgya phrag du ma dag gis yongs su bskor cing sil snyan dang / bro gar dang / dga' mgur spyod pa'i tshogs mang po brgya snyed kyis yongs su bskor to //
analyzed: lha mo'i tshogs brgya phrag du ma dag gis yongs su bskor cing sil snyan dang / bro gar dang / dga' mgur spyod pa'i tshogs mang po brgya snyed kyis yongs su bskor to //
translated: He is surrounded by hundreds of thousands of goddesses, and by many hundreds of thousands of assemblies of music, dance, and pleasure.

original: gzhal med khang chen po gser gyi lan kan ni bres /
analyzed: gzhal med khang chen po gser gyi lan kan ni bres /
